title: Why do Riven mains talk so much about Riven's High skill cap?
body:
Yes Riven has a high skill cap, but you ain't BoxBox or BRNA playing against Master/Challenger and LCS players who know every matchup to a high level. You're spamming Q vs Golds who don't know the matchup well enough to realise when they can be all-in'd. And once Riven gets the first kill in lane it is snowball time gg because jungler isn't going to camp the lane to help their laner recover vs Riven. Then  you can look forward to Riven 1v3'ing the team and typing GG EZ NUBZ or OMG MY TEAM SUX I WIN LANE BUT THEY FEED. REPORT! 

As soon as a champ appears in top lane that counters Riven suddenly you start to see just how unskilled these same Riven players are. When I see boxbox play vs Garen, Darius and Hecarim I'm in awe at how well he plays those difficult matchups against extremely skilled players. I watch boxbox play vs Hecarim a lot and it amazes me how well he plays that. That is the high skill cap of Riven.

When I play as Hecarim vs Riven players, I see nothing but freelo riders who have no idea what to do when they actually have to use their brain and can't just mash out abilities every time they are on cooldown and if they make a mistake... they can actually be killed instead of being able to just dash away with one of their near infinite dashes or BS movespeed.

Without fail  50% of these Riven players respond with "Fucking OP champ Hecarim".

**TLDR, Riven is high skill cap, but she is extremely strong even in the hands of unskilled players. All those people talking about her as being high skill cap, aren't even remotely close to skilled with her and think auto attacking between Q's is skillful.**

{{champion:222}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:222}}

replies.body: She definitely is high skill cap, but I think people forget that a high skill cap champ can also have a low skill floor. Most any scrub can pick up Riven and do decently, but really good players can also do some crazy plays with her.
Another good example: Yi. Low skill floor, high skill ceiling.
This here. People seem to think high skill cap = hard to play. This is not true.
also people think high skill cap = champ has alot of jumps so he requires "mechanics" n shit. i honestly believe darius, garen and master yi have the highest skillcap.
Why garen?

because all his abilities are so straight-forward and basically allow zero surprise and playmaking that you have to be incredible thoughtfull of how to play exactly to not become obsolete, but his abilities are at the same time powerfull if used correctly . he can do things no other champions can do but none of them is flashy. garen doesnt make you look cool, he makes your opponents look like idiots. hes the might of demacia, not the lcsbigplays of demacia. like, he doesnt require alot of speed and combinations to play, he requires brain, the absolutely most rare and hardest to acquire resource in this game.

Reasonably high skill floor. Have you played against a Riven thats still learning Riven? They will lose lane with her. I main top lane, and I play against a lot of crap Rivens in my mmr. I rarely lose to one.

The problem with Riven isn't even really a problem with her. Its the players she's playing against. She's a feast or famine champ, and in bronze - gold, all the Riven needs to get paired against, is just one bad player that doesn't know what they're doing, and she's going to snow ball. 


Every time a Riven thread of any kind pops up, all I can really think when I read it is what the mentality of the player that lost lane to one was, and I usually  think is along the lines of "I played my lane incorrectly, but i'm just going to say Riven's broken, because I can't possibly be bad at this game, as I clearly deserve challenger"

Riven does not have a high skill floor. Any braindead can dominate with her at lower skill levels.

I mained Yasuo a lot in top lane for about 200 games. I struggled so hard with the Riven matchup. I memorised the timing on all her cooldowns, I watched vids of yasuo players laning against Riven to get an idea of how to play  against her. Eventually I was able to break even in the lane, and sometimes win, but that required intense concentration and one mistake could be fatal, but at the very least I denied her the chance to snowball.

I decided to try out Riven and low and behold first game enemy has a mid yasuo. I lane swap mid to play against yasuo. The yasuo player wasn't great but I could see he wasn't new to yasuo and he was at least as good as I was with Yasuo.  

Yasuo dominated the lane early while I just tower hugged trying to learn how to even play Riven. All I remembered was from my experience as Yasuo was that when Riven reaches level 6 she can just straight up all in you 100-0 if you make 1 mistake and if Yasuo tries to ffight back he will lose 100% oof the time. Eventually Yasuo makes a poor dash attack and I say fuck it I'M GOING ALL IN!

I spammed some random combination of E, Q and W and then Mashed R at the end, and Yasuo was LITERALLY DELETED FROM MY SCREEN.
He comes back to lane, a minute later my ulti is back and I just do the same thing again and again...

Went on to snowball carry the game while literally having no idea wtf I was doing.
After that I was like fuck it I'm not playing Yasuo anymore to get wrecked by clueless Riven players, so I switched to a champ that dumpsters Riven to give them a taste of their own medicine. Now when I lane vs Riven I don't even have to try and she gets destroyed.

{{champion:222}}

Riven counters Yasuo. Yasuo is in a very bad spot right now on top of that. Your argument as to why she has a low skill floor, is that Riven has an easy time against a champion that SHE COUNTERS post 6. A champion that you just made evident that you mained, and that frustration of you not being able to beat your counter, is likely the reason you posted this thread. 

On top of that, skill doesn't stop being important after laning phase. Ever see a clueless Riven come to a team fight? May as well be a 4v5 because chances are, she's not positioned correctly, or playing her correctly, which is very important in late game. You may be able to get away with not knowing her mechanics well in the lane phase, against something she counters, but once team fights role around, you're going to be very heavy for your team to carry. Your positioning, rotation, as well as timing are all going to be crucial things for you to have a basic understanding of to excel at team fights, and even then, if you know all that, which btw, is basic Riven knowledge required to be a DECENT Riven, all that has to be done, is for someone to drop Exhaust on you, and not only are you in the middle of the enemy team, with all your CD's blown, but now you have no escape, and no damage. Good bye, Riven.


Garen, all you do, is run into the team, pop Q if your slowed, and your defensive CD to soak up damage, if you get CC'd back off and try again your Garen, so you're not going to die. Try it again, sit on top of the carries spinning, and then ult Execute. That would be low skill required. Only way to screw that up is if your team wasn't ready to follow up with you.

Riven, Charge up your third Q, if you can't get the pick before Q wears off, wait for CD and try again, position in a bush behind enemy team, if bush is warded, reposition, wait for them to engage, if they don't, you can't fight because you'll just get blown up. When they finally do engage, flash into 3rd Q range, and land the knock up on one of their carries, land one Auto, then W, then Auto again, proc hydra active, then use wind slash. You've successfully blown up 1 person. That is assuming, you someone didn't interrupt your combo, or peeled you off your target. This is a pretty basic Riven team fight combo, that isn't very easy to get right without a bit of practice, and even still, if you don't manage to lock up the entire back line, chances are your combo is going to get interrupted and you're going to get blown up. This combo is very easy to screw up, but yet is one of her easier ones to pull off. 

She definitely doesn't have a low skill floor. It may not be super high, but its definitely not low.

Literally the only way this can be avoided for a new Riven player, is if the enemy team doesn't group or team fight and you can run around and pick people off all game. Cool part about this? You literally can pick your targets, so you're almost guaranteed to win the fights you choose, as you chose them for a reason. 

I also like how you say you swapped to playing champions that dumpster her, so you don't even need to try. Are you aware right now in the tank meta, almost every laner that played commonly top lane, is considered a counter for Riven? Renekton, Jax, Hecarim, Darius, Garen, Fiora, Swain, Pantheon, Cho'gath, Irelia, Volibear, Kennen, Malphite, Shyvanna. The only way she wins any of these match ups, is if she gets ahead early game, and her lane enemy decides to build straight damage over tankiness, and thats not the Riven being easy to play, thats her opponent being an idiot. 

The only lanes she has the advantage in top lane is like.. Nasus, and Vlad, and even then, a good Vladimir and Nasus wont lose lane to a beginner Riven. 


I swear, Riven threads are all the same. Very little knowledge, a whole lot of crying.

>I also like how you say you swapped to playing champions that dumpster her, so you don't even need to try. Are you aware right now in the tank meta, almost every laner that played commonly top lane, is considered a counter for Riven? Renekton, Jax, Hecarim, Darius, Garen, Fiora, Swain, Pantheon, Cho'gath, Irelia, Volibear, Kennen, Malphite, Shyvanna. 

Yes I am aware of the champs that counter Riven, I've played almost all of those champions and  thats why I chose Hecarim as my main and Irelia and Swain are my off-mains.

>The only lanes she has the advantage in top lane is like.. Nasus, and Vlad, and even then, a good Vladimir and Nasus wont lose lane to a beginner Riven.

So in a meta where all her counters are commonly picked she still has the highest win rate in the top lane at 54.4% in plat+ despite the fact that she is apparently at a 'disadvantage' in almost every matchup top lane.

I guess Riven players are just really really really good at League of Legends.

{{champion:222}}

With that logic Amumu, morde, and donger players must be really good as well. Since their win rates are high across the board. 

Using win rates as a basis for one argument alone is very skewed. Win rates can inflate for many variables, and do not mean a champion is currently broken. Or else I'd be banning the dongerevery game. Which btw, the Meta isn't good for him either. No mobility in a league of mobility. Yet his win rate has been over 50 across the board for as long as I can remember.

What's a skill cap, and how is it different from "hard to master"? Is that the maximum effectiveness of a champ or...I mean, "skill cap" by itself makes no sense.

Or, if it's the same as "hard to master", what was so wrong with saying that, that now we say skill cap?
Theres a bit of difference. A prime example would be Yorick. He doesn't have a high skill cap. But he is considered hard to master.

> [{quoted}](name=r11na,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OhxjyKvu,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-05-07T12:50:13.428+0000)
>
> **TLDR, Riven is high skill cap, but she is extremely strong even in the hands of unskilled players. All those people talking about her as being high skill cap, aren't even remotely close to skilled with her and think auto attacking between Q's is skillful.**

On the one hand, yeah, she's a *powerful* high skill-cap champion. This is called "low skill floor, high skill ceiling." It doesn't take much to learn, but there's a noticeable gap between a learning Riven player and a great Riven player in the same way that there's a gap between the two sides of the Grand Canyon.

On the other, people complain about her being easy to learn, but completely ignore that over 50% of the champions in the roster are *equally* easy to learn. There is one (maybe two) Marksman that you can actually call high-skill, only a handful of mages that are more complex than "Rotate spells, acquire kill, hope you walk away fast enough or use Zhonya's/Flash to survive," and bruisers...bruisers are about as complex as a concrete slab. Tanks are at least a step above bruisers in complexity in most cases, and then Supports, while not necessarily complex, are like playing an RTS where the AI controls the rest of your units.

>and then Supports, while not necessarily complex, are like playing an RTS where the AI controls the rest of your units.

Part and parcel to why I love support.
... And simultaneously hate it.
lol and if you dominate her she goes afk. I always pick Lee Sin top vs her and they almost always leave the game after they feed 3 kills.
she does have the highest leave rate of all champs... which also coincides with toxicity levels lol. Which is precisely why I love to fuck a riven in lane. Just watch the show afterwords.

you left out one of riven's greatest counters.  Hue Hue Hue.

also riven mains talk about her non existent skill cap because they want to boost their ego to the point where they won't listen to anyone with evidence that they are wrong.
{{champion:58}}
{{champion:82}} is what most people say "hue" in reference to. I've never played him, so I don't get it either.
listen to his laugh on the korean servers. It'll make more sense.

There is a very high skillcap on riven. There is just a  low skill floor.

Boxbox and BRNA are proof that there is a high skill cap. 

Besides people who are "Riven mains" that aren't at least plat, arent actually riven mains. They are just people who play Riven a lot. 

Being Riven main implies a certain mastery of the champion, and people at that level dont have it. 

As far as being extremely strong in the hands of unskilled players, she is no different than any other snowbally champion. Anyone can pick up Katarina and crush a game. Also Jinx and her stupid fucking AOE crits, I have a friend that is a TERRIBLE league player and he goes off with Jinx all the time.
so, what does make you a "main riven" when you reach plat? you suddenly become plat or is "plat" your subjective point of where players arent complete trash anymore?

I'm not a Riven main, in fact I rarely play riven because I'm pretty bad with her, she was the first and only champ I ever returned because I was so bad (I bought her again when she came on sale). Any time one of my friends says they are thinking about picking up Riven I tell them about her high skill cap, so its not just Riven mains that talk about it.

> [{quoted}](name=Ferrous Oxide,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=OhxjyKvu,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-07T13:16:54.807+0000)
>
> I'm not a Riven main, in fact I rarely play riven because I'm pretty bad with her, she was the first and only champ I ever returned because I was so bad (I bought her again when she came on sale). Any time one of my friends says they are thinking about picking up Riven I tell them about her high skill cap, so its not just Riven mains that talk about it.

Riven does have a high skillcap to the point where she's like Yasuo and Zed. Bad positioning can ruin your combo's not to mention getting cc'd and bursted down in fights. essentially if she's a melee adc like trynd or yi but more tanky with her shield but she functions on the same level.
My Plat roome claims that the hard part with Riven is getting your ADC fed and that's why good Rivens always take TP. (Since you can apparently kill your opposite without an ignite.)

I heard that the main thing about her is memorizing how much damage you can deal/take in a certain fight. If you learn that you will faceroll yourself until your enemies learn how to play with counterpicks.
Had a Riven once tell me that Kayle takes no skill. They were just mad they couldn't kill me because I always had my R before their R.

Kayle's ballin', and one of the most versatile champs in the game, if not the most versatile. Especially as a jungler. Similar to Evelynn, you can almost build whatever you want and still get results. AD, AP, AS, tank, any role you want, go whatever you want, it just might work.

Though I still prefer AP Kayle while jungling. Makes her W and R oh-so-nice in ganks, skirmishes, and teamfights.

It's true. I always Garen vs Riven and you can tell a good Riven from a freelo-rider in less than 5 trades. Good Rivens can win almost any lane 1v1 because that trash-can champ has a ton of slack built in to her stupid kit.
